result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Richard Molenda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Graffiti, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.017(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas Richard Molenda in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Defendant Thomas Richard Molenda in custody.  
Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Plea/sentencing.  Hearing proceeded.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.

COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record. 

On state's motion the Court orders 'REPEATER' penalty enhancer DISMISSED.  

Statements made as to sentencing  by the state, defense, and defendant.


The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction with 64 days credit.

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR.  The Court refers this matter to the Mental Health Unit. 

Conditions of probation include:

-Pay mandatory applicable court costs, fines,  and all surcharges by the end of probation period; any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Obtain mental health assessment and complete any recommended follow up care/treatment;
-Participate in any counseling or programming determined appropriate by agent;
-Perform 100 hours of community service at a non-profit agency;

Defendant advised of this right to appeal this sentence.  Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Charge Amended as follows:  REPEATER penalty enhancer DISMISSED.
TOT Justicepoint with absolute sobriety, no possession or use of controlled substnace, no firearms

Attorney Thomas K Hackbart in court, defendant Thomas Richard Molenda not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for Chad Wozniak for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter in court for return of warrant.  Judge Rothstein opted to keep this matter on this calendar.  Court will set $100.00 cash bail TOT Justicepoint with standard conditions of supervision.  Case set for plea/sentencing on 3-16-2016.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 2-9-2016
Bench Warrant in file.  
Case is adjourned to 2-18-2016 at 8:15
for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 38.
Notice is given to Public Defender's Office and District Attorney.
Justice Point report - Discharge Summary - received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Denis John Stingl for Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Gabriela Leija previously in court before the case was called. Case in court for plea and sentencing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court deferred on the ruling of forfeiture of bail at this time.
Filed, Justice Point Report dated 10/28/2015.

Defendant Thomas Richard Molenda in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Thomas Richard Molenda in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for bail hearing. Defense counsel has secured housing for the defendant in the special needs housing unit through the Milwaukee County Housing Division. Defense advised the court the defendant's probation will be transferred from Brown County to Milwaukee County. Court ordered cash bail set at $250.00 signature bond with turnover to Justice point monitoring. Justice Point to ensure the defendant is conveyed to the housing secured by defense counsel. Defense requested a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Arguments heard as to bail. Court ordered cash bail set at $200.00 with turnover to Justice Point Enhanced Supervision.

Defendant Thomas Richard Molenda in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Thomas Richard Molenda in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
BRANCH 25 FOR BRANCH 24. Case set for return on doctor's report. Parties have reviewed the report. Neither party is challenging the findings in the report. Court accepts the findings in the report and finds the defendant competent to proceed. Court will retain this matter going forward. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Thomas Richard Molenda not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel needs time to review the doctor's report with the defendant.  Case passed until 1:30 pm.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.

Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24 .  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 9-20-15.
Bench warrant in file.

Defendant Thomas Richard Molenda in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Thomas Richard Molenda in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from JusticePoint:  Discharge Summary.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court earlier.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered the stay lifted and a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court.  Kathleen B. Schrader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date. Case adjourned to branch 24 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and FIled, Justice Point Report.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Thomas Richard Molenda in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Thomas Richard Molenda in custody.  
Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  

Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
